alert.note: Alert for Hancock; Pearl River (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 19 at 1:27AM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of south central St. John The Baptist, northwestern St. Bernard, St. Charles, Orleans, St. Tammany, northern Lafourche, northwestern Jefferson and northwestern Plaquemines Parishes, Hancock and southwestern Pearl River Counties through 230 AM CST... At 126 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Bush to 11 miles south of Madisonville to near Thibodaux. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... New Orleans, Slidell, Thibodaux, Picayune, Metairie, Hahnville, Marrero, Chalmette, Avondale, Harvey, East New Orleans, Timberlane, Belle Chasse, Laplace, Jefferson, Gretna, Harahan, Westwego, Pearl River and Abita Springs. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 211 and 256, and between mile markers 259 and 273. Interstate 10 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 13. Interstate 12 between mile markers 62 and 84. Interstate 59 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 11. Interstate 59 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 14. Interstate 310 between mile markers 1 and 11. Interstate 510 between mile markers 1 and 3. Interstate 610 between mile markers 1 and 4. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
